com.googlecode.streamflyer.experimental.stateful.util
Class RegexTransitionState

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.streamflyer.experimental.stateful.util.RegexTransitionState
All Implemented Interfaces:
State, MatchProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
RangeFilterState
public class RegexTransitionState
extends Object
implements State, MatchProcessor

This state refers to a token (described by a regular expression). If that token is found, then the state might be changed.

The default behavior of this class neither changes the state nor the character buffer. Override

  • findState(StringBuilder, int, MatchResult),
  • modifyBuffer(StringBuilder, int, MatchResult),
  • processWithoutMatch(StringBuilder, int, boolean, AfterModification)
in order to modify the default behavior.

Since:
14.09.2011
Author:
rwoo

nextTokensRegexModifier

private RegexModifier nextTokensRegexModifier

nextState

private State nextState
The next state determined by evaluating the result of a match. Null if there was no match.

Method Detail

modify

public StatefulAfterModification modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                        int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                        boolean endOfStreamHit)
Description copied from interface: State
Does the same as Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) but, additionally, the returned result contains the new state for the StatefulModifier.

Specified by:
modify in interface State
See Also:
State.modify(java.lang.StringBuilder, int, boolean)

process

public MatchProcessorResult process(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                    int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                    MatchResult matchResult)
Description copied from interface: MatchProcessor
Processes the given match. The match processor is allowed to modify the given character buffer but it must not modify the characters before the first modifiable character in the buffer because the characters before that position are considered unmodifiable.

Specified by:
process in interface MatchProcessor
Parameters:
characterBuffer - Must not be null.
firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer - See the parameter with the same name in Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean).
matchResult - The match that is found in the given character buffer. Must not be null.
Returns:
Returns an object that describes where to continue the matching.
See Also:
MatchProcessor.process(java.lang.StringBuilder, int, java.util.regex.MatchResult)

findState

protected State findState(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                          int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                          MatchResult matchResult)
Finds the next state (evaluating the given match result).

The default implementation returns 'this' state.

modifyBuffer

protected int modifyBuffer(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                           int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                           MatchResult matchResult)
Modifies the character buffer if the token was found. Returns the position of the first character that is modifiable.

The default implementation does not modify the buffer. Returns the end of the match as new first modifiable character in the buffer.

processWithoutMatch

protected AfterModification processWithoutMatch(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                                int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                                boolean endOfStreamHit,
                                                AfterModification afterModification)
Modifies the character buffer if no token is found.

The default implementation returns the given AfterModification.
